_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:33:25 using v2.7
title: How has the rate of hospital admissions for under 19 year olds changed?
analysis_commentary:
It is useful to further disaggregate and look at condition specific trends so that more concrete problems and actions can potentially be identified. For asthma, as the most common childhood chronic condition, between 2011/12 and 2012/13 there has been an increase in emergency hospital admissions from 194 to 221 per 100,000.

Hopefully, we can include trends in diabetes and epilepsy admissions in future indicator updates.
data_source: Local Authority Child Health Profiles, ChiMat Health Intelligence Network
